findings.title: Unchecked low-level call return value in sendMoney
findings.explanation: The contract uses `_target.call.value(_value)(_data)` without checking the returned success flag. A failed call will not revert the transaction, leading to the possibility that the owner believes the transfer succeeded when it did not.
findings.fix_suggestion: Capture and check the return value of the low-level call: `(bool success, ) = _target.call.value(_value)(_data); require(success, "Call failed");`

findings.title: Potential integer overflow in depositsCount
findings.explanation: The fallback function increments the `depositsCount` counter without any overflow checks, allowing the counter to wrap around if enough deposits are made.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use a SafeMath library for incrementing counters or add an explicit overflow check, e.g., `require(depositsCount + 1 > depositsCount); depositsCount++;`
